title: Wave Optics and Electromagnetic Spectrum

vocab.definition: Full range of electromagnetic radiation from radio waves to gamma rays
Distance between two consecutive peaks or troughs of a wave
Number of wave cycles that pass a point per second
Bending of light when it passes from one medium to another
Interaction between waves that can result in constructive or destructive patterns

teachingNotes: Use prisms and diffraction gratings to demonstrate wave properties. Connect to applications in technology and medicine.

sample.question: What is the full range of electromagnetic radiation called?

truefalse.question: All electromagnetic waves travel at the speed of light in a vacuum.

multiplechoice.question: What is the bending of light when passing between media?

fillintheblank.question: The distance between two wave peaks is the ________.

shortanswer.question: How are wavelength and frequency related for electromagnetic waves?
